II. CANONICAL FORMULATION OF THE :formula: MODEL
According to the cosmological principle, the line elements of the homogenous isotropic cosmological models take as

where :formula: is the scale factor, and :formula: for the open, flat, and closed FRW models, respectively.
In what follows, we present the canonical formulation of the :formula: following Ref. [31]. For the spatially non- compact :formula: 0, -1 models with topology homeomorphic to :formula: one introduces an "elemental cell" :formula: on the homogeneous spatial manifold :formula: and restrict all integrals to this elemental cell. Then one chooses a fiducial metric :formula: on :formula: with :formula: being the left- and right-invariant fiducial one- forms in the :formula: and only the left-invariant fiducial one-forms in the :formula: model. Classically, the dynamical variables of LQC are obtained by symmetrically reducing those of full LQG. In the full theory, the dynamical variables consist of the :formula: connec- tion :formula: and the densitized triad :formula: with the nontrivial Poisson bracket

where :formula: with :formula: being the Newtonian constant, and :formula: is the Immirzi parameter [39, 40]. The connection :formula: is
related to the spin connection :formula: and the extrinsic curvature :formula: by :formula: It turns out that the symmetry- reduced extrinsic curvature :formula: is diagonal in the basis of left- invariant one-forms for the :formula: models. While, unlike the :formula: model where :formula: vanishes, the symmetry-reduced spin connection :formula: in the :formula: model takes the form [31]

and thus it is nondiagonal. Hence the symmetry-reduced con- nection and densitized triad for the :formula: model read [31]

As in the :formula: model, the Gauss and diffeomorphism con- straints of the gravitational part are automatically satisfied for the symmetry-reduced variables in Eqs.
